author: Mike Vorel from The Seattle Times
title: As setbacks mount and injuries multiply, it‚Äôs difficult to believe in these Mariners
text:
Beside the stairs connecting the dugout and clubhouse in T-Mobile Park, there‚Äôs an increasingly cruel reminder of the Mariners‚Äô recent success. More specifically, there‚Äôs an instantly iconic photo of catcher Cal Raleigh ‚Äî arm extended, bat aloft, eyes fixed on a baseball disappearing into a crowd of 44,754 fans who endured a 21-year drought to see that day.
Since that photo was taken on Sept. 30, 2022 ‚Äî since Raleigh‚Äôs solo homer sealed a 2-1 win over Oakland, cementing Seattle‚Äôs first playoff appearance since 2001 ‚Äî 662 days have passed.
It feels like a whole lot more.
Because, in the 662 days since, the Mariners have failed to maintain that momentum ‚Äî falling two games shy of a division title in 2023, before attempting to retool by adding veteran position players to a scintillating starting staff.
Recently, the results have been hard to watch (
and increasingly easy to boo), as a dramatically one-dimensional roster lost a 10-game lead in the AL West. That includes eight losses in their last nine games and a 2-1 defeat to the otherwise anemic Angels Wednesday to secure their first sweep of the season.
Oh, and above that photo sitting beside the stairs? Three increasingly ironic words beckon in neon blue:
GOOD VIBES ONLY
On Wednesday, the vibes inside T-Mobile Park were understandably ominous. After updating the media on injuries to centerfielder Julio Rodriguez, shortstop J.P. Crawford and top prospect Felnin Celesten prior to the game, general manager Justin Hollander concluded: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had better weeks.‚Äù
Then the Mariners made a bad week worse ‚Äî as reliever
Gregory Santos sustained a knee injury while allowing the tying run in a frustratingly familiar loss. After left fielder Luke Raley flew out to end the game, a crowd of 39,953 rained boos like hot dogs falling from heaven.
The vibes?
They could be better.
‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got to realize that at the end of the day, this is a game. We have to enjoy what we‚Äôre doing,‚Äù said Raleigh, who went 1 for 4 in defeat. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not enjoying playing baseball, you need to probably get out. I understand, though. Guys are frustrated because they don‚Äôt have the numbers; we‚Äôre not performing as well and it‚Äôs hard to have fun.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs kind of like the chicken or the egg. Which comes first: do you have fun before you start winning, or do you have to win to start having fun? That‚Äôs kind of where I see the group at right now.‚Äù
Here‚Äôs where the group is at, in more technical terms. At 53-51, the Mariners somehow trail the Astros by just a single game in an abysmal AL West. After dropping nine of their last 10 series, they travel for a three-game set this weekend against the historically horrible White Sox (27-77), before more significant tests against Boston (54-47) and Philadelphia (64-38). They have the seventh-easiest schedule (based on opponent winning percentage) the rest of the way, while Houston sits at 18th.
Thanks to an exemplary starting staff and a dreadful division, the flawed and flailing Mariners remain in the hunt.
They‚Äôre buyers, believe it or not.
For those in the ‚Äúnot‚Äù camp: your pessimism is well placed. This is a front office, after all, that added Jorge Polanco, Mitch Haniger, Mitch Garver and Luis Urias in the offseason to solidify a sputtering offense.
And, well ‚Ä¶
Polanco: .200/.285/.298, -0.3 WAR
Haniger: .207/.287/.342, -0.6 WAR
Garver: .168/.285/.343, -0.1 WAR
Urias: .152/.264/.316, -0.1 WAR
Hollander and president of baseball operations Jerry Dipoto essentially struck out, much like the Mariners.
But for those in the ‚Äúbelieve‚Äù camp? Meet Scott Servais. Minutes after Wednesday‚Äôs 2-1 loss, the Mariners‚Äô manager ‚Äî who, two games earlier, called the team‚Äôs effort ‚Äúinexcusable‚Äù ‚Äî was a fountain of defiant faith.
‚ÄúI do believe we will get this going. It‚Äôs just a struggle right now.‚Äù
And ‚Ä¶
‚ÄúWe will [get the ship righted]. I truly believe that.‚Äù
And ‚Ä¶
‚ÄúIt will turn. It can be a cruel game, and it‚Äôs a beautiful game. You‚Äôve got to kind of grind your way through it, and we will.‚Äù
Perhaps Servais was trying to convince himself, as much as anyone. Or maybe it was a plea for Dipoto and Hollander to translate similar belief into bats and bullpen help.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see what happens,‚Äù Servais said of the trade deadline, which finally arrives Tuesday. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not really my department. My department is trying to get the most out of the group we have here, and I have to do better, quite frankly.‚Äù
So, yes: the Mariners still have ample time to make a playoff push. And yes, they‚Äôre a sweep of the immensely sweep-able White Sox away from conceivably reclaiming a division lead. And yes, much of the core that watched Raleigh dramatically end the drought remains on the roster 662 days later.
But the vibes inside T-Mobile Park may also be beyond salvaging, as a starting staff‚Äôs collective prime yields repeated 2-1 defeats. As the realization dawns that a bat or two at the deadline might not cure a two-month (or year, or decade) malady. As Raleigh‚Äôs photo ‚Äî the supposed opening of a winning window ‚Äî feels increasingly far away.
As setbacks mount, and injuries multiply, it‚Äôs increasingly difficult to believe.

author: www.ole.com.ar
title: Dibu h√©roe otra vez: su posteo, las reacciones y el pedido de una estatua
text:
Emiliano Mart√≠nez lo hizo de nuevo: ataj√≥ dos penales y el Aston Villa elimin√≥ de la Conference League al Lille, en Francia, el pa√≠s al que llen√≥ de tristeza por su rol en la final del Mundial de Qatar. El arquero repiti√≥ el bailecito de Doha. Los mand√≥ a callar y luego les mostr√≥ la camiseta a los galos.
Dibu poste√≥ im√°genes de su atajada y del dedo en la boca. "Here we go" (ac√° vamos), escribi√≥. Eso fue festejado por uno de sus compa√±eros de Selecci√≥n, Marcos Acu√±a, con emojis.
Tambi√©n hubo muchas repercusiones medi√°ticas. Por ejemplo, en el sitio Birmingham Mail, referente de la ciudad en la que juega el Aston Villa, pidieron una estatua para el argentino, que ya tiene una en Mar del Plata, lugar de nacimiento. "Le encantaba la tanda de penales e hizo lo que mejor sabe hacer para poner a Villa entre los cuatro semifinalistas".
The Times, de Londres, opin√≥ que fue el h√©roe del Aston Villa. Y lo valor√≥ as√≠: "Mart√≠nez no es un villano que se acobarde y ya hab√≠a molestado a la afici√≥n local al tomarse su tiempo con sus saques de meta, por lo que lo amonestaron en la primera parte. Cuando hizo callar a los fan√°ticos del Lille detr√°s arco despu√©s de salvar el primer penal de Nabil Bentaleb, estos se acercaron al frente de la grada para acercarse, arroj√°ndole objetos".
En tanto, Le Parisien, de Par√≠s escribi√≥: "Cruel desilusi√≥n para el Lille, eliminado en los penales. El Lille crey√≥ durante mucho tiempo que se hab√≠a clasificado, pero perdi√≥ al final de una tanda en la que el portero argentino Dibu Mart√≠nez volvi√≥ a ser noticia".
Le Figaro: "Provocativo para muchos, el portero argentino empuj√≥ al Lille hacia la salida".
Hubo medios, como L'Equipe, y La Voix do Nord, de Lille, que evitaron hacer referencia a Dibu tanto en t√≠tulo como en bajada...

author: Nicondra Norwood
title: Fantastic fall festival weather
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - It‚Äôs a beautiful weekend with plenty of sunshine and warm but comfortable temperatures, starting out in the 60s south of the lake and the 50s north on Saturday.
Expect afternoon highs to bounce into the low 80s. Make sure to keep the sunblock and sunglasses handy as you head out to a jam-packed weekend of activities. Sunday looks just as nice, with temperatures a smidge warmer.
The big story is looking ahead to our first real fall front. Ahead of the front Monday, compressional heating will allow it to get a bit warm, with highs bouncing back to near 90. It‚Äôs very dry, so no rain to speak of, but we will see even lower humidity. Temperatures will dip into the 70s for highs by midweek with some 40s for lows north of Lake Pontchartrain.
The chill won‚Äôt last long, with temperatures rebounding again by Friday.
See a spelling or grammar error in our story? Click Here to report it. Please include the headline.
Subscribe to the Fox 8 YouTube channel .
Copyright 2024 WVUE. All rights reserved.

author: Alex House
title: Miami's Mario Cristobal gets roasted after timeout fiasco in Pinstripe Bowl loss to Rutgers
text: Miami football is ready to move on from an overall unsuccessful season that is defined by mind-boggling mistakes and unmet expectations. But no one seems to be in a bigger hurry to get to 2024 than Mario Cristobal, following his questionable decision-making in the Pinstripe Bowl versus Rutgers. The Hurricanes head coach hung onto his two remaining timeouts instead of attempting to get the ball back from the Scarlet Knights in the closing seconds. Miami would have still needed a miracle, but that is something any team should willingly accept when faced with terrible odds. Moreover, the Canes might not have even been in this unfavorable position had Cristobal exercised better time management throughout the game- which was one they ultimately lost, 31-24. These miscues come after the former Miami offensive tackle (1989-92) [opted not to execute](https://clutchpoints.com/miami-football-news-mario-cristobal-explains-botched-decision-blew-hurricanes-win-vs-georgia-tech) a quarterback kneel in what should have been a surefire victory over Georgia Tech back in October. The Hurricanes fumbled and the Yellow Jackets made them pay with an unlikely touchdown drive. Frustration has festered since then, but the ending of Thursday's bowl game somehow leaves everyone [even more bewildered](https://twitter.com/IraHeatBeat/status/1740505398275350651?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1740505398275350651%7Ctwgr%5E329e9d359d8836bb6bdbb85ae21ff1abb683bf31%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwp.clutchpoints.com%2Fwp-admin%2Fpost.php%3Fpost%3D2611634action%3Dedit). Mario Cristobal will have two timeouts to use in the offseason after Miami loses a one-score game in which the Hurricanes had the ball last. ‚Äî Barrett Sallee üá∫üá∏ (@BarrettSallee) [December 28, 2023] I do not understand how Mario Cristobal can be in charge of this program in the morning. ‚Äî Ian Hest (@IanHest) [December 28, 2023] Wondering what Mario Cristobal is going to do with those two spare timeouts next season? Are there any offseason game- management online classes available? ‚Äî Ira Winderman (@IraHeatBeat) [December 28, 2023] I wonder what Mario Cristobal is going to do with those timeouts in the offseason. Maybe take them to Six Flags, get a nice selfie with them on a roller coaster. ‚Äî Zach Barnett (@zach_barnett) [December 28, 2023] Mario Cristobal returned to Miami to set records and he certainly has after guiding the Hurricanes to their first loss against Rutgers in program history. The Scarlet Knights were previously 0-11 against the U. [#Noles] [pic.twitter.com/J61UQA340J] ‚Äî Dustin Lewis (@DustinLewisNG) [December 28, 2023] ‚ÄúWondering what Mario Cristobal is going to do with those two spare timeouts next season?,‚Äù the Sun Sentinel's Ira Winderman posted on X. ‚ÄúAre there any offseason game-management online classes available?‚Äù A major adjustment is needed by this coaching staff if the team is going play closer to its talent level next season. Despite signing a 10-year contract in 2021, Cristobal's job security is not set in stone. Just look at Jimbo Fisher. The program will have to thoroughly evaluate their current situation and determine if immediate improvement can be attained under this regime. As it stands, Miami football is already facing uncertain times at quarterback with the [transfer of Tyler Van Dyke](https://clutchpoints.com/tyler-van-dyke-predictions-transferring-wisconsin-football). Clarity is a must on the sidelines. It will be a long, long trip back from Yankee Stadium for this embattled squad.

author: Ver√≥nica Dom√≠nguez El Diario de Ju√°rez
title: Destaca IMSS trabajo de personal de enfermer√≠a en su d√≠a
text:
Clasificado El Diario La mejor forma de comprar y vender - Visitar
Ciudad Ju√°rez.- En el marco del ‚ÄúD√≠a del Personal de Enfermer√≠a‚Äù conmemorado el 6 de enero, el Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS) en Chihuahua, reconoci√≥ el trabajo que realizan hombres y mujeres que conforman el personal de Enfermer√≠a.
Actualmente, la plantilla de profesionistas es de 4 mil 963 en la entidad, de esa cantidad 4 mil 510 pertenecen al R√©gimen Ordinario y 453 del Programa IMSS-Bienestar.
El titular de la instituci√≥n en el estado, el doctor Jos√© Antonio Zamudio Gonz√°lez, dijo que los enfermeros son parte fundamental en la atenci√≥n de la derechohabiencia chihuahuense.
‚ÄúA todos ellos reconocemos su trabajo c√°lido y humano hacia nuestra derechohabiencia‚Äù, destac√≥ Zamudio Gonz√°lez.
El funcionario tambi√©n reconoci√≥ el inter√©s de estos trabajadores y trabajadoras de la salud por capacitarse de manera permanente con el fin de elevar la calidad en el servicio, por lo que reiter√≥ el compromiso del IMSS de seguir apoyando a esta importante categor√≠a para fortalecer el trato que actualmente se brinda a los pacientes.
‚ÄúNuestro amplio reconocimiento y felicitaci√≥n a este importante talento humano, que se caracteriza por ser el pilar en la atenci√≥n que otorga el IMSS‚Äù, dijo el titular de la instituci√≥n.
En 1931, el doctor Jos√© Castro Villagrana, entonces director del Hospital Ju√°rez de M√©xico estableci√≥ el 6 de enero como el ‚ÄúD√≠a del personal de Enfermer√≠a‚Äù. Desde ese entonces, el pa√≠s reconoce en esta fecha la enorme labor realizada por el personal en favor de la salud.

author: Matt Margolis
title: Trump Stays on Primary Ballot, Says Colorado Secretary of State ‚Äì PJ Media
text:
Earlier this month, the Colorado State Supreme Court voted 4-3 that Trump is ineligible to run for the presidency, thereby unable to appear on the state‚Äôs ballot. According to the four justices who voted in the majority, the 14th Amendment renders Trump ineligible to be president.
Advertisement The Colorado Republican Party‚Äôs appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court is still pending, but the Colorado Secretary of State‚Äôs office has already weighed in on the matter and says that Trump will remain on the ballot. For now.
"Donald Trump will be included as a candidate on Colorado‚Äôs 2024 Presidential Primary Ballot when certification occurs on January 5, 2024, unless the U.S. Supreme Court declines to take the case or otherwise affirms the Colorado Supreme Court ruling,‚Äù the Colorado Secretary of State's office said in a statement .
This is hardly Secretary of State Jena Griswold defying the will of the state Supreme Court.
"Donald Trump engaged in insurrection and was disqualified under the Constitution from the Colorado ballot. The Colorado Supreme Court got it right,‚Äù Griswold claimed without evidence. "This decision is now being appealed. I urge the U.S. Supreme Court to act quickly, given the upcoming presidential primary election.‚Äù
The Colorado Supreme Court ruling essentially declared that even though Trump has never tried for or been convicted of sedition or participating in an insurrection, he is nevertheless guilty.
Advertisement There‚Äôs a good reason why Trump has never been charged. Simply put, the allegations fall apart when you consider the evidence. Trump was still addressing the crowd when the Capitol violence erupted , and there is substantial proof that different groups had planned to storm the Capitol well in advance .
Even Trump‚Äôs words on that day disprove the insurrection claims. He explicitly urged his supporters to partake in peaceful protest, stating during his speech, ‚ÄúI know that everyone here will soon be marching over to the Capitol building to peacefully and patriotically make your voices heard."
Related: Here‚Äôs What You Should Know About the Four Justices Who Deemed Trump Ineligible to Run for President
The fact that the Colorado Supreme Court and even the Colorado Secretary of State insist that Trump should be treated as guilty of a crime for which he is not been tried or convicted makes it likely that the Supreme Court will take up this case, especially since various other states have rejected similar efforts to remove him from the ballot. Experts on both sides of the aisle believe it will be overturned.
Advertisement Some Republicans have responded to the Colorado Supreme Court ruling by suggesting that Biden should be removed from the ballot in other states for insurrection as well as he has allowed illegal immigrants to come across the border into our country in record numbers.
‚ÄúSeeing what happened in Colorado makes me think ‚Äî except we believe in democracy in Texas ‚Äî maybe we should take Joe Biden off the ballot in Texas for allowing 8 million people to cross the border since he‚Äôs been president, disrupting our state far more than anything anyone else has done in recent history,‚Äù Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick told Fox News‚Äô Laura Ingraham before Christmas.

author: Molly Claire Goddard
title: Leah Remini and Angelo Pag√°n Divorcing After 21 Years of Marriage: 'We Both Changed'
text:
Leah Remini and Angelo Pag√°n Divorcing After 21 Years of Marriage: 'We Both Changed'
Leah Remini and Angelo Pag√°n are calling it quits.
The King of Queens alum, 54, sadly took to
"Well, here we are. After 28 years together and 21 years of marriage, we have decided to file for divorce," the announcement began. "This decision came after a lot of
thought and care, and as hard as divorce is, we are approaching this with a positive outlook because we know it‚Äôs what‚Äôs best for us."
"We are proud of how we have
worked through this together. Yes, we‚Äôre sad, and we‚Äôve got some figuring out to do as we continue to move forward into our new normal ‚Äî together still in many ways, and apart in some new ones," she added.
Despite
the heartbreak, the former couple made it clear they will still very much be present in each other's lives. "But here‚Äôs the thing: we‚Äôve been best friends for so many years. We are still celebrating holidays together, watching our favorite tv shows together, and gathering as a family," the Second Act alum made clear.
Remini addressed the elephant in the room of what exactly happened between the former lovebirds, who met in 1996. "So, the big question ‚Äî why? To put it simply, we both changed, as people do, and we got used to playing roles that didn‚Äôt fit us anymore," she wrote.
Jennifer Lopez and Leah Remini Rekindle Their Friendship After 2022 Falling Out Over Ben Affleck Marriage Leah Remini Receives Associate's Degree From NYU at 53, Admits Scientology 'Brainwashed' Her Into Believing She Wasn't 'Smart Enough' Leah Remini Details Intense Battle With Depression and Anxiety After 'Escaping' Scientology: 'It's a Constant Struggle'
"After a lot of effort and consideration, we‚Äôve decided to take this step, which reflects who we are today. Our bond is still strong ‚Äî it‚Äôs just evolved into something different. We think a marriage that lasted this long and created so many beautiful memories, especially raising our incredible daughter, is something to celebrate," the sitcom star, who wed Pag√°n in 2003, explained.
"From our perspective, this marriage was a
huge success. And now, we‚Äôre looking forward to creating even more cherished moments ‚Äî just in a different way. We want to be as transparent as we can be here because, for years, we shared our marriage so publicly, whether it was on our specials on VH1 or our reality show, which ran for two seasons on TLC," Remini noted.
Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for the
 OK! newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what OK! has to offer. It‚Äôs gossip too good to wait for!
The Scientology and the Aftermath star wrapped up the shocking news on a positive note. "We are sharing this unknown territory with you all as we take our first steps into this next stage of our lives publicly. We would love for everyone to have more access to different kinds of relationship stories and not feel so isolated in navigating the changes that millions of couples make every year. We hope our journey can inspire others to see that relationships ‚Äî whether they change or end ‚Äîaren‚Äôt failures. We‚Äôll keep sharing snippets of our lives as we navigate this new chapter. Love, Leah & Angelo," she concluded the post.
